channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Shanghai slammed by strongest typhoon to hit city since 1949
item.description: Typhoon Bebinca hit Shanghai with gale-force winds and heavy rain, disrupting travel plans at the start of a national festival. Flights and high-speed rail services were canceled as the city initiated top-level emergency responses. The storm is expected to weaken while moving inland through Jiangsu, Zhejiang, and Anhui provinces. Hundreds of thousands of people in Shanghai and other coastal cities were evacuated.

item.title: Pakistan: Amid worsening human rights situation, another bullet-riddled body found in Balochistan
item.description: A bullet-riddled body identified as Mohsin was found in Kech district, Balochistan. Originally from Mand and residing in Gomazi, Mohsin's death is part of a pattern of violence and enforced disappearances in the region. Authorities are investigating the circumstances surrounding his death.

item.title: 'Doesn't sound like the man I know:' Son defends 'loving' Ryan Routh after arrest for Trump assassination attempt
item.description: The son of the alleged gunman who targeted former President Trump on his Florida golf course described his father as loving and caring. He expressed disbelief at the accusations, citing his father's humanitarian efforts in Ukraine. The incident involved a Secret Service agent firing shots after spotting a rifle, leading to the suspect's escape.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Violin in space? SpaceX Polaris Dawn creates another history, see video
item.description: SpaceX Polaris Dawn marked a historic moment with Sarah Gills playing the violin in space for the first time, performing "Rey's Theme" from "Star Wars." Led by Jared Isaacman, the mission also set a new altitude record for human spaceflight since NASA's Apollo missions, reaching 875 miles above Earth.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Apparent assassination attempt on Donald Trump: 10 points
item.description: US Secret Service agents fired at a man with an AK-style rifle near former President Donald Trump while he was golfing in Florida. The suspect fled but was later apprehended. Trump is safe, and the FBI is investigating it as an assassination attempt. President Biden and Vice President Harris have been informed.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Shanghai on red alert as Typhoon Bebinca makes landfall, strongest in decades
item.description: Early Monday, Typhoon Bebinca struck Shanghai with fierce winds reaching up to 151 km/h and heavy rainfall. Authorities issued a red alert, evacuated coastal residents, and canceled numerous flights. Train services were also disrupted during the mid-Autumn Festival holiday. Popular tourist destinations like Shanghai Disney Resort have been temporarily closed.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Vance doubles down on cat-eating claims
US, UK say Russia 'sharing N-secrets with Iran' for ballistic missiles
item.description: US and UK officials are increasingly worried that Russia is exchanging nuclear technology with Iran for ballistic missiles to aid its war in Ukraine. This issue was highlighted during discussions between British PM Keir Starmer and President Biden. Secretary of State Antony Blinken noted the exchange, emphasizing concerns over Iran's advancing nuclear program.

item.title: China censors allow a Ye gig amid economic woes
item.description: Ye, the rapper formerly known as Kanye West, is scheduled to perform in China on Sunday. The performance will be held in Hainan, an island province. This move is part of China's efforts to stimulate consumer spending and promote tourism post-Covid lockdowns. Despite previous restrictions on foreign entertainers, Ye's celebrity status appears to have prevailed.

item.title: Shoes off, laptops out for airport tray photo. Move on, say those in queue
item.description: Influencers are flooding social media with aesthetically arranged airport tray photos, showcasing travel accessories. Some find this trend inconsiderate and unhygienic, while others see it as expressive. The TSA permits these staged photos if they don't cause delays or issues at security checkpoints.

item.title: Joe Biden 'relieved' Trump is safe after apparent assassination attempt
item.description: President Joe Biden responded to an apparent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump at his West Palm Beach property. A suspect is in custody, and investigations are ongoing. Biden praised law enforcement's vigilance and reiterated that political violence has no place in the country, directing resources to ensure Trump's continued safety.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Ryan Wesley Routh? Man held for 'apparent assassination attempt' on Trump
item.description: Ryan Wesley Routh, armed with an AK-47-style weapon, targeted former President Donald Trump at his Florida golf club. A Secret Service agent noticed the rifle and opened fire before the suspect fled. Authorities later apprehended Routh, who has a criminal record and frequently posted anti-Trump sentiments on social media while supporting Democratic candidates.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Safe and well,' Trump assures after 'apparent' assassination attempt at Florida golf club
item.description: Donald Trump reported he is safe following gunshots near him at his South Florida golf club. The FBI considers it an assassination attempt. A Secret Service agent responded to the threat, and law enforcement tracked the suspect's vehicle using a witness's photo. Both President Biden and Vice President Harris have been briefed on the incident.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Netanyahu vows to extract 'heavy price' for missile attack by Houthi rebels
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has vowed to retaliate against Yemen's Houthi rebels after they successfully launched a hypersonic ballistic missile into central Israel. The missile traveled over 2,000 kilometers before fragmenting in midair, causing no injuries. This is the first time Houthis have reached central Israel with their attacks.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 34 Iran women prisoners on hunger strike: Jailed Nobel peace laureate
item.description: On September 15, 2024, thirty-four female political prisoners in Iran's Evin Prison started a hunger strike to mark two years since the 'Woman, Life, Freedom' movement and Mahsa Amini's death. The protest aims to oppose government oppression and show solidarity with the Iranian people.

item.title: Trump's 'mass deportation' threat evokes images of WW2 internment camps
item.description: A misleading social media post in Springfield, Ohio claimed Haitians were eating pet cats, leading to threats and rumors. City officials have found no credible evidence supporting these claims. Nevertheless, Donald Trump has announced plans for mass deportations of Haitian immigrants, stirring unrest and excitement among his radical followers.
item.dc:creator: Chidanand Rajghatta

item.title: Teen accused of killing groom just before wedding gets caught at Canadian border
item.description: A 17-year-old from Long Island was arrested at the Canadian border following a fatal hit-and-run in Harlem that killed a groom just hours before his wedding. The teenager faces charges in Manhattan Criminal Court, with his attorney claiming the case is weak and pointing out his client's health issues including autism and epilepsy.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Rising floodwaters trigger evacuations in Czech Republic and Poland
item.description: Severe flooding has struck Central Europe due to torrential rains, heavily impacting the Czech Republic. Authorities declared top-level flood warnings across nearly 90 locations, prompting mass evacuations and widespread power outages. The situation remains critical in Poland and Austria, where fatalities have been reported. Meteorologists caution that conditions could deteriorate further with more heavy rainfall expected.

item.title: 'US ready to turn page on politics of division, hate': Harris takes jibe at Trump, says 'baton is in our hands'
item.description: At the Congressional Black Caucus’s Phoenix Awards dinner, Vice President Kamala Harris contrasted her administration's agenda with former President Trump's, focusing on healthcare and economic opportunity. President Joe Biden emphasized his commitment to unity and rebuilding the middle class while condemning divisive actions like the January 6 insurrection and attacks on affirmative action.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Imran Khan comprares Pakistan's ruling dispensation with Yahya Khan's era, says 'no point' in calling Shehbaz Sharif PM
item.description: Imran Khan, the imprisoned former prime minister of Pakistan, has drawn parallels between the current political environment and the era of military ruler Yahya Khan. He criticized the ruling coalition and institutions for corruption and lack of rule of law. Khan also highlighted poor economic conditions and urged for more foreign investment in Pakistan.
